passage:
(1) The Aztec Empire emerged as a dominant power in Mesoamerica during the 15th and early 16th centuries, creating one of the most sophisticated civilizations in the pre-Columbian Americas. Founded in 1428 through a triple alliance of city-states—Tenochtitlan, Texcoco, and Tlacopan—the empire rapidly expanded through military conquest and strategic political alliances. At its height, the Aztec domain encompassed much of central Mexico, with its capital Tenochtitlan (modern-day Mexico City) serving as the political and ceremonial heart of their civilization, impressively built on an island in Lake Texcoco.

(2) Aztec society was highly structured and hierarchical, with distinct social classes that included nobles (pipiltin), commoners (macehualtin), serfs, and slaves. Political authority was centered on the emperor, or huey tlatoani ("great speaker"), who ruled with both secular and religious power. The empire's sophisticated administrative system included provincial governors, tax collectors, and judges who maintained order across their territories. Education was mandatory for all children regardless of social class, though noble children received more extensive training in specialized schools called calmecac, where they studied history, religion, astronomy, and the arts.

(3) The Aztec economy thrived on a complex agricultural system that featured chinampas—raised farming beds constructed in shallow lake beds that yielded multiple harvests annually. Their extensive trade networks facilitated the exchange of goods such as textiles, pottery, obsidian tools, and luxury items throughout Mesoamerica. Markets were central to Aztec life, with the main marketplace at Tlatelolco accommodating up to 60,000 people daily. The empire collected tribute from conquered territories, which formed a significant portion of their wealth and resources, including food, textiles, precious metals, and other valuable commodities.

(4) Religion permeated every aspect of Aztec culture, with a sophisticated pantheon of deities governing natural forces and human activities. Their cosmology divided the universe into multiple planes connected through ritual, with the material world existing as just one component of reality. The controversial practice of human sacrifice, while often emphasized in historical accounts, was embedded within a complex religious framework that viewed blood offerings as necessary to sustain the cosmos and nourish the gods. Alongside these dramatic rituals existed rich artistic traditions in sculpture, poetry, music, and dance that reflected both religious devotion and aesthetic sophistication.

(5) The Aztec Empire's decline began with the arrival of Spanish conquistadors led by Hernán Cortés in 1519. Taking advantage of existing political tensions, Cortés formed alliances with the Aztecs' enemies, particularly the Tlaxcalans, who had long resisted imperial control. The Spanish also benefited from the devastating impact of introduced diseases like smallpox, which decimated indigenous populations lacking immunity. In 1521, after a brutal siege of Tenochtitlan, the Spanish and their indigenous allies toppled the empire, marking the beginning of Spanish colonial rule. Though militarily defeated, Aztec cultural influence persisted, forming an essential element of Mexico's modern cultural identity and historical consciousness.

questions.question: He ________ be the owner of the building; I saw him entering with a key card.
She bought a ________ antique wooden dining table for her new apartment.
By this time next year, I ________ for this company for exactly two decades.
The ________ of the old factory into luxury apartments has transformed the neighborhood.
She told me she ________ feeling unwell since the previous day.
I need to ________ smoking; it's affecting my health.
If I ________ how difficult the hike would be, I would have worn better shoes.
Look at those dark clouds. It ________ rain later today.
She always ________ traveling by train rather than flying.
The conference will take place ________ May 15th ________ the Grand Hotel.
I ________ emails all morning, but I've only managed to answer five so far.
The construction team ________ the project by the end of next month.
________ you practice, ________ you'll improve at playing the piano.
________ I borrow your car for the weekend? I promise to return it with a full tank.
The museum, ________ was renovated last year, now attracts twice as many visitors.
The company decided to ________ the launch of their new product due to technical issues.
We need to ________ a solution to this problem before the deadline.
The new safety regulations will ________ effect next month.
It's important to ________ cultural differences when doing business internationally.
After considering all options, they decided to ________ with the original plan.
The theater play was completely sold out, so we couldn't ________ tickets for the evening performance.
She ________ her talent for music from her mother, who was a concert pianist.
We were planning to go hiking, but had to ________ because of the bad weather.
The company is ________ a new marketing strategy to increase sales.
I can't ________ what she sees in him; they seem so different from each other.
Many modern vehicles are becoming increasingly ________, able to navigate and make decisions with minimal human input.
New business opportunities often ________ when traditional industries undergo technological disruption.
The solar panels on the roof ________ enough electricity to power the entire house.
The investigation will ________ whether there was any misconduct in the handling of the case.
The endangered species ________ primarily in the wetlands of the southern region.
The artist used innovative techniques to ________ realistic textures in the digital artwork.
According to recent ________, over 70% of graduates find employment within six months of completing their degree.
Immigrants must often ________ into a new culture while maintaining aspects of their own cultural identity.
The CEO implemented a new ________ culture that emphasized teamwork and collaborative decision-making.
The politician's statement sparked a heated ________ about immigration policies.
Most people naturally ________ toward options that provide immediate benefits rather than long-term rewards.
It's essential to ________ clearly when working in a team to avoid misunderstandings.
As wine ages and becomes more ________, its flavors develop greater complexity and depth.
The ________ of heart disease is significantly higher in populations with poor dietary habits.
Despite the evidence, the suspect continued to ________ any involvement in the crime.
According to paragraph 1, the Aztec Empire was established through:

options.C: Peaceful diplomatic negotiations with all neighboring peoples

questions.question: Which of the following accurately describes Aztec social structure according to the passage?

options.A: An egalitarian society with no class distinctions
options.B: A two-class system of nobles and commoners
options.C: A hierarchical society with several distinct social classes
options.D: A society where social mobility was impossible

questions.question: The term 'chinampas' in paragraph 3 refers to:

options.B: Raised farming beds that increased agricultural productivity
options.C: Markets where goods were traded throughout Mesoamerica
options.D: Tribute items collected from conquered territories

questions.question: According to the passage, what was distinctive about education in Aztec society?

options.A: It was exclusively available to the nobility
options.B: It was mandatory for all children regardless of social class
options.C: It focused primarily on religious training
options.D: It was conducted entirely in specialized schools called calmecac

questions.question: The word 'pantheon' in paragraph 4 most closely means:
According to paragraph 4, how does the passage characterize human sacrifice in Aztec culture?

options.A: As a practice invented by Spanish chroniclers to justify conquest
options.B: As a barbaric practice without any cultural meaning
options.C: As a ritual embedded within a complex religious worldview
options.D: As a primarily political tool used to control conquered peoples

questions.question: Which factor did NOT contribute to the fall of the Aztec Empire according to paragraph 5?

options.A: Spanish alliances with the Aztecs' enemies
options.B: The devastating impact of European diseases
options.C: Internal rebellion among the Aztec lower classes

questions.question: The passage suggests that the marketplace at Tlatelolco was significant because:

options.A: It was where the Spanish first encountered the Aztecs
options.B: It accommodated up to 60,000 people daily
options.C: It was where human sacrifices were conducted
options.D: It served as the political center of the empire

questions.question: Which statement best reflects the passage's conclusion about the Aztec legacy?

options.A: It was completely destroyed by Spanish conquest
options.B: It remains influential in modern Mexican cultural identity
options.C: It was preserved primarily through Spanish historical accounts
options.D: It had little lasting impact on Mesoamerican civilization

questions.question: The primary purpose of this passage is to:

options.A: Compare Aztec civilization to other Mesoamerican cultures
options.B: Defend the religious practices of the Aztec Empire
options.C: Criticize Spanish colonization of indigenous civilizations
options.D: Provide an overview of Aztec society, culture, and historical trajectory
